definition: the year's horoscope augurs ill (idiom); an unlucky year
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
to be successful in every endeavor

sentences.english: But the mood in Copenhagen yesterday did not seem conducive to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 但昨日哥本哈根的气氛似乎不利于各方达成妥协。

sentences.english: What if someone says something negative about me?
sentences.chinese: 如果有人说什么对我不利的东西呢？

sentences.english: This will purchase the lives of people after the arrival of an adverse effect .
sentences.chinese: 这将购买人的生命的到来后，产生不利的影响。

sentences.english: It has encountered many unfavorable criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 同时，还遇到许多不利的批评。

sentences.english: Unhealthful fats include saturated and trans fats.
sentences.chinese: 不利于健康的脂肪包括饱和脂肪及转化脂肪。

sentences.english: The excessive or insufficient silt-content is unfavorable to the vibrating consolidation of sandy soils.
sentences.chinese: 粉粒含量过多或太少均不利于砂土的振动固结。

sentences.english: But drug companies have repeatedly been shown to bury unflattering data.
sentences.chinese: 然而制药公司却一再隐瞒那些对自己不利的数据。

sentences.english: Just saying “um” or “ah” here and there won’t do it.
sentences.chinese: 若只是一味的“嗯”或“啊”这样不利于谈话的进行。

sentences.english: Governments, in turn, are in bad shape to recapitalize them.
sentences.chinese: 相反，政府处于不利的地位去调整资金。

sentences.english: The valley of his household feel very bad.
sentences.chinese: 户谷感觉到情况对自己非常的不利。
这是邓不利多教授交给我的。

sentences.english: The moisture of the stones, and the viscous nature of the timber framework furnished but poor supports to which to cling, either for hand or foot.
sentences.chinese: 潮湿的石头和粘滑的沟槽对手和脚都是不利的支撑点。

sentences.english: You may not get that job because your age is against you.
sentences.chinese: 你也学得不到那份工作，因为你的年龄对你不利。

sentences.english: There isn't a scintilla of evidence against me.
sentences.chinese: 没有一点不利于我的证据。

sentences.english: The increased WOB is not good for deviation control.
sentences.chinese: 当转速一定时，提高钻压不利于防斜打直。

sentences.english: It seemed the worst moment for the Rossoneri, but Pippo Inzaghi changed everything.
sentences.chinese: 看上去形势对红黑军团不利，但因扎吉改变了一切。

definition: to be beneficial/to be good for
harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
